III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Allegation On 3/10/23, two youths were alone in the bathroom together.
Investigation I notified Youth E’s foster care worker and Complainant/Therapist
that I was assigned this investigation. Neither expressed
additional concerns about the facility.
I notified Rights Officer of the allegation. He alerted me that
Youths E and A are, or were, romantically interested in one
another and are placed on different wings.
I interviewed Youth E with Rights Officer present. On 3/10/23 she
said she and five other youth were in the school gym playing
volleyball supervised by three staff. One youth was on one-to-one
status supervised by Staff 3. The other five were being monitored
by Staffs 1 and 2. Youth E described the gym bathroom as a
room with multiple stalls.
Youth E said she went into the bathroom for privacy to read a two-
page letter from Youth A. Note: Passing letters among residents
is prohibited. After reading the first paragraph, Youth E said
Youth A surprised her by entering the bathroom. “I ran out (of the
bathroom) when I was able to. Staff 1 was approaching to get her
(Youth A) out.”
Youth E would not discuss what was said or done in the
bathroom. She said there is only one youth allowed in there at a
time.
I interviewed Youth A with Rights Officer present. She claimed
she went into the bathroom without permission and was not aware
Youth E was in there. She said she and Youth E are “just friends”
and nothing happened in the bathroom. “Youth E just walked out
of the stall.”
I interviewed Staff 1 with Rights Officer present. She has worked
at Vista Maria for eight years. On 3/10/23, Staff 1 said she, Staff
2, and Staff 3 were supervising six youth in the gym. “I was
2

monitoring the exit door and sat at the far end of the gym away
from the restroom. I saw Youth A go in the bathroom.” Another
youth shouted that Youth E was already in there. “I ran to the
bathroom…It was a matter of seconds. Youth E came out as
soon as Youth A went in. Youth E had an irritated look on her
face.”
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone. He has worked at the facility
for 22 years. Staff 2 corroborated Staff 1’s account of the staff
supervision in the gym.
Rights Officer and I viewed video of the gym. Youths E and A
were alone in the bathroom for 37 seconds when Staff 1 reached
the bathroom. According to both youths, nothing happened in the
bathroom.
This investigation and report were completed before Government
Worker 1 was assigned to investigate it. Government Worker 1
did not substantiate.
Analysis The direct care staff were providing sufficient supervision and
intervened appropriately upon noticing Youth A entered the
bathroom without permission.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
